title: Preparation of a Bacteriophage T4-based Prokaryotic-eukaryotic Hybrid Viral Vector for Delivery of Large Cargos of Genes and Proteins into Human Cells
procedures: Plasmid construction (3 days)Hoc and/or Soc can be efficiently displayed on the T4 capsid as the linker for AAV attachment. Here, we constructed pET-28b-Soc and pET-28b-BAP-Hoc for Hoc/Soc protein expression. Additionally, the BirA-expressing plasmid pET-21a-BirA was purchased from Addgene (plasmid no.  20857  ). Plasmids pAAV-DJ (# VPK-420-DJ  ), pAAV-Helper (# VPK-400-DJ  ), pAAV-GFP (# AAV-400  ), pAAV-luciferase (# AAV-321  ), and pAAV-mCherry (# VPK-410  ) were purchased from Cell Biolabs.pET-28b-Soc construction (3 days)Amplify RB69 Soc gene fragment (228 bp) from RB69 phage genomic DNA using Thermo Fisher 2x Phusion high-fidelity PCR master mix according to the manufacturer’s protocol (https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/F531S#/F531S[href=https://www.thermofisher.com/order/catalog/product/F531S#/F531S]).The primers are shown as follows, where the underlined sequences indicate the recognition sequences for the respective restriction enzymes:Soc NheI Forward:5′-GCATCCGCTAGCGGTGGTTATGTA A ACATCAAA-3′.Soc XhoI Reverse:5′-GTGCTCGAGCACCACTTACTGGTGTAGGGGTAAAC-3′.Add 1/10 volume of 10x DNA loading buffer to each PCR sample and load 50 μl reaction onto the 1.5% agarose-TBE gel, and separate them by agarose gel electrophoresis. Additionally, load the 100 bp plus DNA marker for size verification.Cut the DNA band of expected size using a clean blade, purify Soc DNA using QIAGENQIA quick gel extraction kit according to the manufacturer’s protocol.Digest 1 μg purified Soc PCR product with NheI and XhoI by following the manufacturer’s instructions with incubation at 37 °C for 4 h. Meantime, digest 1 μg pET-28b vector plasmid with NheI and XhoI at 37 °C for 4 h.To prevent vector recircularization during ligation, dephosphorylate the 5′-ends of the digested pET-28b with 1 μl Fast AP thermos sensitive alkaline phosphatase without changing the restriction enzyme buffer and incubate at 37 °C for 40 min.Separate the digested Soc insert and pET-28b vector using 1.5% and 1% agarose gel electrophoresis, respectively. Then purify them using the QIAGENQIA quick gel extraction kit according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Store the digested insert and vector at -20 °C until needed.Ligate insert and vector at a molar ratio of 5:1 using T4 DNA ligase at 22 °C for 2 h (in a water bath). Prepare the vector backbone without the insert as a negative control to evaluate vector recircularization.Transform E. coli DH5α competent cell with the ligation product using heat shock according to the manufacturer’s instructions and incubate on the kanamycin-LB plate overnight at 37 °C.Pick 2-3 single colonies and inoculate each into 3 ml LB medium supplemented with 50 μg/ml of kanamycin in 15 ml tubes. Incubate the tubes in a shaking incubator overnight at 220 rpm and 37 °C. Purify plasmid DNA from the above cultures using the QIAGEN plasmid mini kit as per the manufacturer’s protocol.Sequence clones with T7 and T7ter sequencing primers to confirm the proper insertion of Soc sequence into the pET-28b backbone. The resulting pET-28b-Soc plasmid should contain hexa-histidine tag at the both NH2- and COOH- termini of Soc.pET-28b-BAP-Hoc construction (3 days)Perform two rounds of PCR reactions to amplify BAP-Hoc from T4 genomic DNA using 2x Phusion high-fidelity PCR master mix and the following three primers. The underlined sequences indicate the recognition sequences for the respective restriction enzymes.BAP-Hoc Forward 1:5′-ATCGAGTGGCACGAGGGTCTTTCGATGACTTTTACAGTTGATATAACTCC-3′BAP-Hoc NheI Forward 2:5′-TTCTAGCTAGCGGTCTTAACGACATCTTCGAGGCACAGAAGATCGAGTGGCACGAGGGTCTTTCG-3′BAP-Hoc HindIII Reverse:5′-ATAAAGCTTTTATGGATAGGTATAGATGATACCAGTTTC-3′To label Hoc protein with biotin, we genetically fused biotin acceptor peptide (BAP) to the N-terminus of Hoc. Perform the first round of PCR by fusing Hoc to part of the BAP sequence using the BAP-Hoc Forward 1 and BAP-Hoc HindIII Reverse primers. Obtain full-length BAP-Hoc (1,197 bp) by the second round of PCR using the BAP-Hoc NheI Forward 2 and BAP-Hoc HindIII Reverse primers.Digest BAP-Hoc PCR product and pET-28b vector with Nhe I and Hind III.

Then, sub-clone the digested BAP-Hoc fragment into the pET-28b vector according to the Steps A1b to A1j. The resulting pET-28b-BAP-Hoc plasmid should contain Hoc in-frame fusion with BAP, a 15-aa vector biotin acceptor peptide (GLNDIFEAQKIEWHE) at the NH2-terminus of Hoc, and also a hexa-histidine sequence at the COOH-terminus of Hoc.Protein expression, purification, and modification (4 days)Soc and BAP-Hoc protein expression and purification (3 days)Transform 15 ng of pET-28b-Soc or pET-28b-BAP-Hoc into 20 μl BL21-CodonPlus (DE3)-RIPL competent cells using the heat-shock method according to the manufacturer’s protocol. BL21-CodonPlus(DE3)-RIPL cells contain a ColE1-compatible, pACYC-based plasmid that has chloramphenicol resistance for protein expression. Plate the transformed cells on LB-kanamycin/chloramphenicol plates (50 μg/ml kanamycin and 30 μg/ml chloramphenicol) and incubate overnight at 37 °C.Pick a single colony and inoculate into a 500 ml flask containing 50 ml Moore’s medium containing 50 μg/ml kanamycin and 30 μg/ml chloramphenicol. Incubate overnight in a shaking incubator at 220 rpm and 37 °C.Inoculate 20 ml of overnight cultures into 1 L of Moore’s medium containing 50 μg/ml kanamycin and 50 μg/ml chloramphenicol. Incubate the cultures at 220 rpm and 37 °C until the cell density reaches OD600 = 0.4-0.5. Then, cool down the temperature of the cultures to 28 °C in a shaking incubator for 40 min at 220 rpm before adding IPTG.Add 1 ml 1 M IPTG to the 1 L cultures (final concentration 1 mM) and incubate for 2-3 h at 28 °C and 220 rpm for inducing protein expression.Harvest the induced cells by centrifuging the cultures using 500 ml centrifuge bottles and GS3 rotor of Sorvall RC-5C plus centrifuge at 7,000 rpm (8,288 x g) for 10 min at 4 °C. Discard the supernatant and store the pellet at -80 °C until purification.

Resuspend the pellet with 50 ml HisTrap binding buffer containing one pill of complete proteinase inhibitor cocktail on ice. Lyse the cells by French press at 10,000 psi twice.Centrifuge the cell lysate using 30 ml tubes and SS34 rotor in Sorvall RC-5C plus centrifuge at 18,000 rpm (38,724 x g) for 30 min at 4 °C.Discard the pellet and harvest the supernatant containing soluble Soc or BAP-Hoc protein. Filter the supernatant through 0.22 μm Millipore filter units before loading onto the HisTrap column.Set up 1 ml HisTrap HP column on AKTA-prime system. Wash the column with 30 ml of water, followed by 30 ml of HisTrap binding buffer to equilibrate the column.Load the filtered supernatant onto the HisTrapHP column at a flowing speed of 1 ml/min (Increased flow rate will decrease protein binding to column.), followed by washing the loaded column with 50 ml HisTrap binding buffer.Set up the elution procedures of the HisTrap HP column on the AKTA-prime system. The parameters are as follows: Concentration (% Buffer B): 0; Gradient Length: 40; Target (% Buffer B): 100; Flow Rate: 1 ml/min; Fraction Base: ml; Fraction Size: 1; Pressure Limit: 0.3. Using the HisTrap binding buffer for pump A and the HisTrap elution buffer for pump B, elute the His-tag protein with a 20-400 mM linear imidazole gradient.Collect and pool the peak fractions, and concentrate the pool to 4-5 ml using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration (3 kDa cutoff for Soc and10 kDa cutoff for BAP-Hoc) according to the manufacturer’s protocol.Set up AKTA Fast Protein Liquid Chromatography (FPLC) system to further purify by size-exclusion chromatography as well as desalt Soc or BAP-Hoc proteins. Wash the Hi-load 16/600 Superdex 200 column with 150 ml gel filtration buffer.

Load the concentrated His-tag protein (4-5 ml) onto the Hi-load 16/600 Superdex 200 column with a flow rate of 1.0 ml/min and up to 0.5 MPa pressure.Collect and pool the peak fractions from gel filtration elution based on the molecular size, and concentrate using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration.Check purity by SDS-PAGE and quantify the concentration of the Soc and BAP-Hoc protein using NanoDrop. The concentration measurement parameters are as follows: Soc, molecular size 10.5 KDa, Extinction coefficients 11,460, Abs 0.1% (= 1 g/L) 1.088; BAP-Hoc, molecular size 44.9 KDa, Extinction coefficients 70945, Abs 0.1% (= 1 g/L) 1.580. Aliquot the concentrated protein and store at -80 °C until needed.Soc protein biotinylation (4 h)Biotin N-Hydroxysuccinimide (NHS) esters are the most popular type of biotinylation reagent. NHS-activated biotins react efficiently with primary amino groups (-NH2) of protein (the side chain of lysine residues and the N-terminus of each polypeptide) to form stable amide bonds.Exchange Soc protein gel filtration buffer (Tris buffer) with 1x PBS buffer (pH 7.4) using 10 ml Zeba Spin Desalting Columns (7K MWCO) according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Avoid buffers containing primary amines (e.g., Tris or glycine) as these will compete with the biotinylation reaction. Proteins in Tris or other amine-containing buffers must be exchanged into an amine-free buffer at pH 7.2-8.0. Concentrate Soc protein in PBS buffer to ~5 mg/ml using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration.Remove the vial of NHS-Biotin reagents from -20 °C storage and fully equilibrate it to room temperature for 30 min before opening to avoid moisture condensation inside the container. NHS-Biotin reagents are moisture-sensitive.Immediately before use, dissolve 2.0 mg NHS-Biotin reagent in 590 μl of dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO) solvent to prepare a 10 mM solution.

Add 500 μl of 10 mM biotin reagent solution to the 500 μl 5 mg/ml Soc protein solution (20-fold molar excess). Incubate reaction on ice for 2 h.Purify the labeled Soc protein using 10 ml Zeba Spin Desalting Columns (7K MWCO) according to the manufacturer’s protocol. Finally, elute the Soc-biotin protein in 1x PBS buffer (pH 7.4). Aliquot the labeled protein and store at -80 °C until needed.Hoc-BAP-Biotin-Avidin (HBBA) production (8 h)Exchange Hoc-BAP protein gel filtration buffer with 1x PBS-MgCl2 buffer (pH 7.4) using 10 ml Zeba Spin Desalting Columns (7K MWCO) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.Add 1 μM recombinant BirA ligase to 30 μM Hoc-BAP monomer in the presence of 0.3 mM biotin and 5 mM ATP for Hoc-BAP biotinylation. Let the reaction proceed at room temperature for 3 h with gentle mixing on a rocking platform for Hoc-BAP-biotin formation (HBB).Remove the excess biotin using 10 ml Zeba Spin Desalting Columns (7K MWCO). Confirm biotinylation by streptavidin-HRP Western blot analysis.Incubate Hoc-BAP-biotin with avidin at a 1:3 ratio for 1 h at 4 °C to form Hoc-BAP-biotin-avidin complex.Set up AKTA-FPLC system. Wash the Hi-load 16/600 Superdex 200 column with 150 ml gel filtration buffer. Load the biotinylation reaction mixture containing HBB, HBBA, avidin, BirA, and Hoc-BAP onto the Hi-load 16/600 Superdex 200 column with a flow rate of 1.0 ml/min.Collect and pool the peak fractions of HBBA from gel filtration elution based on the molecular size, and concentrate using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration. Check the purity by SDS-PAGE. Aliquot the concentrated protein and store at -80 °C until needed.Bacteriophage T4 head production (3 days)Streak out the glycerol stock of E. coli P301 cells on the LB-agar plate and leave it at 37 °C overnight.

Pick a single colony and inoculate into 20 ml sterile LB + M9A medium (equal volumes of LB and M9A) in a 125 ml flask. Grow at 37 °C for 6-8 h.Inoculate 5 ml fresh E. coli P301 culture into LB + M9A medium (500 ml) at a dilution of 1:100. Leave the cap loose to allow aeration and grow the culture in the shaking incubator at 37 °C to a density of 4 x 108 cells/ml (in the cell counter, if each small square has 5 cells/ml, the cell density is equivalent to 108 cells/ml).Infect the culture with 10-amber.13-amber.hoc-del.soc-delmutant T4 at an M.O.I. (number of phage added/each bacterial cell) of 4. It should be noted that phage T4 has no tropism to human cells, has no known toxicity or pathogenicity, and exhibits no preexisting immunity. The safety of T4 phage application in humans was reported. This involves simply adding a calculated volume of the phage solution into the bacterial culture. Mix the culture as you are adding the phage solution so that the phage is uniformly distributed into the culture. Put the culture back in the shaking incubator for 5 min.Superinfect at the same M.O.I. as above (a second T4 infection). Put the culture back in the shaking incubator and grow for 32 min more. At the 30th min quickly check the cell number under the microscope to see if the cell number begins to reduce. If the cell number is less than 4 x 108 cells/ml, just stop the infection and do centrifugation. If the cell number has not changed, leave the culture at 37 °C for 1-2 min more (Don’t leave for more than 35 min. The cells would have lysed). Reserve the Sorvall centrifuge ahead of time so that it is available when you need it.

Distribute equally into two 500 ml centrifuge bottles. Centrifuge the cells at 7,000 rpm (8,288 x g) for 12 min at 4 °C in the Sorvall RC-5C using GS3 rotor. Discard the supernatant.To the pellet, add 50 ml (25 ml to each bottle) of PI-Mg buffer plus 20 μg/ml DNAaseI. Resuspend the viscous pellet by repeated pipetting. Add 1 ml chloroform and incubate at 37 °C for 30 min in a shaker at 220 rpm to lysis cells and digest DNA.Collect the supernatant by centrifuging at 4,300 x g or 12 min. Discard the pellet. Transfer the supernatant to four 15 ml Corex glass tubes (Be careful to remove the supernatant using disposable pipettes). Centrifuge the supernatant using a SS34 rotor in Sorvall RC-5C plus centrifuge at 18,000 rpm (38,724 x g) for 45 min at 4 °C (using the rubber adapters). Discard the supernatant. The pellet mainly contains T4 viral heads.Add 500 μl of PI-Mg buffer to each pellet. Leave the pellet overnight at 4 °C. Resuspend the pellet. Break the pellet with the tip of the pipette to gently resuspend it. Remove the four tubes pellet into one tube.Conduct second-round low- and high-speed centrifugations. Resuspend the pellet with 1 ml PI-Mg buffer. Then add 50 ml of head binding buffer (no NaCl) for DEAE column purification.Filter the sample using a 0.22 μm filter unit. Load the sample onto a 5 ml DEAE column (1 ml/min) pre-equilibrated with 100-150 ml of head binding buffer (no NaCl). Elute with a linear gradient from 0 mM to 300 mM NaCl (40 ml) in the head binding buffer. Collect the peak fractions (1 ml each).Concentrate the purified heads using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration.Check purity and concentration by SDS-PAGE.

Mix 1/5 volume of T4 head or BSA marker with 5x SDS loading buffer and boil for 10 min. Load 1, 2, 3, and 4 μl of T4 head, as well as 1, 2, 4, and 8 μg of BSA on a 4-20% Tris-Gly SDS-PAGE gel, and electrophorese according to the manufacturer’s instructions.Stain the gel with Coomassie blue R-250 staining solution, microwave for 1 min, and keep shaking at room temperature for 30 min.Remove the staining solution, add destain solution, microwave for 1 min, and keep shaking at room temperature until the background becomes clean.Scan the protein gel with ChemiDoc Imaging Systems and quantify the protein bands with Quantity One software according to the manufacturer’s instructions. Calculate the concentration of T4 head based on the BSA standard curve generated by Microsoft Excel.Aliquot the T4 heads and store at -80 °C until needed.In vitro DNA packaging and protein display of the T4 head (2 days)T4 DNA packaging (1 day)Prepare plasmid DNA pAAV-GFP or pAAV-Luciferase from the corresponding E. coli cultures using the QIAGEN plasmid midi kit as per the manufacturer’s protocol.Linearize pAAV-GFP or pAAV-Luciferase using restriction enzyme XbaI or BglII for T4 head packaging according to the manufacturer’s protocol.Purify the linearized plasmid DNA.Add one volume of 8 M sodium acetate (-20 °C) to the enzyme cutting reaction.Add two-volume of room temperature isopropanol and keep on ice for 30 min.Centrifuge at 18,000 rpm (38,724 x g) for 30 min at 4 °C.Discard the supernatant and rinse with 70% Ethanol.Centrifuge at 18,000 rpm (38,724 x g) for 30 min at 4 °C.Discard the supernatant and air dry pellet (20 min) and dissolve the pellet in DNA elution buffer.Quantify the concentration of linearized plasmid DNA using NanoDrop.Perform in vitro DNA packaging.

Each 20 μl of reaction mixture contains 3 μM full-lengthgp17, linearized plasmid DNA (DNA:heads = 20:1, 2.4 μg pAAV-GFP or 2.8 μg pAAV-Luciferase), 2 μl 10x packaging buffer, and autoclaved MilliQ water. Incubate the mixture at 37 °C for 5 min. Then add 2 x 1010 T4 head and incubate at 37 °C for 30 min.Add 1 μl benzonase nuclease to the packaging reaction and incubate at 37 °C for 20 min to remove excess unpackaged DNA.Check the T4 head packaging efficiency. Release the encapsidated nuclease-resistant DNA by treatment with 50 mM EDTA, 0.5 μg/μl proteinase K, and 0.2% SDS for 30 min at 65 °C. Analyze the packaged DNA by 1% agarose gel electrophoresis.Quantify the amount of packaged DNA using Quantity One software. Define the packaging efficiency as the number of DNA molecules packaged per T4.Keep DNA-packaged T4 head on ice for further protein display assay.T4 protein display (1 day)Add Soc-biotin or HBBA protein (20:1 ratio of Soc-biotin to T4 870 Soc-binding-sites; 20:1 ratio of HBBA to T4 155 Hoc-binding-sites) (Fokine et al., 2004) to the DNA-encapsidated T4 heads as described above, gently vortex to mix, and incubate at 4 °C for 1 h.Sediment the T4 head particles with Soc-biotin or HBBA protein bound at 18,000 rpm (32,150 x g) for 1 h at 4 °C using AM 2.18 rotor in Jouan MR-23i  centrifuge or equivalent.Discard the supernatant to remove the unbound protein.Wash the T4 head pellet containing the bound Soc-biotin or HBBA protein twice with 1x PBS buffer.Incubate the pellets at 4 °C overnight and then resuspend in 1x PBS.Analyze protein-displayed T4 heads by SDS-PAGE as described in procedures from Steps C12 to C15.

Determine the density volumes of Soc-biotin or HBBA and gp23* (major capsid protein) bands for each lane, and calculate the copy number of Soc-biotin or HBBA molecules per capsid using the known copy number of gp23*, which is 930 copies per head.Recombinant adeno-associated virus (AAV) production and biotinylation (6 days)AAV production (5 days)One day before transfection, plate sufficient HEK293T cells (~3 x 106, 12 ml DMEM complete medium) to 100 mm cell culture dishes to achieve 70-80% confluence on the day of transfection.Co-transfect cells with pAAV rep/cap expression vector, pAAV-luciferase, and pAAV-Helper with the ratio of vectors at 1:1:1 (15 μg pAAV-DJ: 15 μg pAAV-Luciferase: 15 μg pAAV-Helper) using Lipofectamine 2000 according to the manufacturer’s protocol.Seventy-two hours after transfection, add 240 μl 0.5 M EDTA (to a final of 10 mM) to the 12 ml DMEM cultures and incubate for 5 min at room temperature. Gently shake the culture dish several times and harvest all media, including cells, in a sterile 50 ml tube.Centrifuge the cell suspension at 150 x g for 5 min. Remove the supernatant and resuspend the cell pellet in 0.5 ml sterile 1x PBS.Freeze and thaw the cell suspension four times by placing it alternately in a dry ice/ethanol bath and a water bath of 37 °C. Remove cell debris by centrifugation at 10,000 x g for 10 min and collect the supernatant as AAV crude lysate.Purify AAV by HiTrap AVB Sepharose HP column according to the manufacturer’s instructions (GE Healthcare, IL). Collect and pool peak fractions.Dialyze AAV pool against PBS-MK buffer overnight in Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes as per the manufacturer’s protocol. Concentrate AAV particles using Amicon Ultra-4 centrifugal filtration (100 KDa size cutoff). Determine AAV titers using a QuickTiter AAV Quantitation kit (Cell Biolabs, CA) according to the manufacturer’s instructions.

Aliquot and store the purified AAV at -80 °C.AAV biotinylation (1 day)Remove the vial of NHS-Biotin reagents from -20 °C storage and fully equilibrate it to room temperature for 30 min before opening to avoid moisture condensation inside the container.Immediately before use, dissolve 4.0 mg NHS-Biotin reagent in 590 μl of DMSO solvent to prepare a 20 mM solution.Add 590 μl of 20 mM biotin reagent solution to the 500 μl AAV solution (~1012 particles). Incubate reaction on ice for 2 h.Add 100 mM glycine to quench biotin reagent.Dialyze labeled AAV against PBS-MK buffer overnight in Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes as per the manufacturer’s protocol to remove excess biotin reagent and byproducts. Confirm biotinylation by streptavidin-HRP Western blot analysis. Aliquot the labeled AAV and store at -80 °C until needed.T4-AAV hybrid vector production (1 day)Distribute 1 ml Ni2+-NTA (nitrilotriacetic acid) agarose beads into a 1.7 ml sterile Eppendorf tube. Centrifuge the beads at 100 x g for 1 min. Remove the supernatant and wash the beads pellet with 1 ml HisTrap binding buffer three times. Resuspend the beads pellet in 0.1 ml HisTrap binding buffer after washing.Add 0.2 ml 1012 T4-Soc-biotin or T4-HBBA particles into Ni2+-NTA agarose beads and incubate for 1 h with gentle shaking at 4 °C.Centrifuge the mixture at 100 x g for 30 s. Remove the supernatant and gently wash the T4-Soc-biotin or T4-HBBA bound beads with 1 ml HisTrap binding buffer five times. Resuspend the beads pellet in 0.1 ml HisTrap binding buffer after washing.For assembly of T4-Soc-AAV assembly, dissolve avidin in HisTrap binding buffer and then add to the T4-Soc-biotin bound beads (1:1 of avidin to T4 870 soc-binding-sites). Incubate for 20 min with gentle shaking at 4 °C. Centrifuge the mixture at 100 x g for 30 s.

Remove the supernatant and gently wash the T4-Soc-biotin-avidin bound beads with 1 ml HisTrap binding buffer five times. Resuspend the beads in 0.1 ml HisTrap binding buffer after washing.Add the biotin-labeled AAV vectors (sub-heading E-2) (4:1 of AAV to T4 particles) to the T4-Soc-biotin-avidin or T4-HBBA immobilized beads and incubate for 30 min with gentle shaking at 4 °C.Remove the supernatant and gently wash the T4-Soc-AAV or T4-Hoc-AAV bound beads with 1 ml HisTrap binding buffer five times. Resuspend the beads pellet in 0.1 ml HisTrap elution buffer after washing. Incubate for 5 min with gentle shaking at 4 °C.Dialyze T4-AAV hybrid viral complex vector against PBS-MK buffer overnight in Slide-A-Lyzer dialysis cassettes as per the manufacturer’s protocol. Aliquot and store at -80 °C until needed.
